page.title: 10Extractive Industry
page.content: The gravel pits in two of our squares are not shown on the map but there is evidence of use because we saw some trucks and there was gravel all over the area.There was a old disused gravel pit filled with water. We discovered a working quarry belonging to Hall Aggregates. We interviewed one of the employees and we found out that they employed twelve men who extracted gravel from a two hundred acre site for the building industry. There is a Civil Engineering Company in our area,called Fawley Engineering. The building,built in the Second World War,as a RAF Radio Station.It later became a primary school and was taken over by Fawley Engineering in 1980.
